sentence.Network_en: He stepped in front of her, barring her way.
sentence.Network_cn: 他走到她前面，挡住了她的去路。

sentence.Network_en: Barring accidents, I believe they will succeed.
sentence.Network_cn: 不出意外的话，我相信他们会成功的。

sentence.Network_en: Barring accidents, we should arrive on time.
sentence.Network_cn: 除非有意外情况，我们应可按时到达。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 15th cent.: from the verb bar + -ing

entry.def: You use barring to indicate that the person, thing, or event that you are mentioning is an exception to your statement.

example.ex: Barring accidents, I believe they will succeed.
example.tran: 不出意外的话，我相信他们会成功的。

means.word_mean: 1. the act of excluding someone by a negative vote or veto

auth_sentence.content: Change to constitution effectively barring Kaunda from future elections.
auth_sentence.res_content: Change to constitution effectively barring Kaunda from future elections.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Change to constitution effectively barring Kaunda from future elections.

auth_sentence.content: Barring injury, Federer should have a long twilight.
auth_sentence.res_content: Barring injury, Federer should have a long twilight.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Barring injury, Federer should have a long twilight.

auth_sentence.content: Barring a miracle, there will be no last hurrah.
auth_sentence.res_content: Barring a miracle, there will be no last hurrah.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Barring a miracle, there will be no last hurrah.

sentences.en: Barring the boss, we all went out for drinks on Friday.
sentences.cn: 除了老板, 我们星期五都出去喝酒了。
